ygData.subject: Re: video cards
ygData.msgSnippet: Yes, more memory seems to be the most important asset. I find using top view reduces bazaar lag considerably. Barto ... Geforce Ti4200 128 mgb memory I still
ygData.messageBody:
Yes, more memory seems to be the most important asset.

I find using top view reduces bazaar lag considerably.

Barto

--- In EverQuest@yahoogroups.com, "Thumlin" <thumlin@h...> wrote:
> I have a P4 2,53 GH with 533 MHZ buss and 512MEG 333MHZ DDR memory,
Geforce Ti4200 128 mgb memory I still get lagg as HELL in bazaar with
200 peps or more. Only thing that will help there in my opinion would
me more memory so I could load all shiat in memory instead of
swapping from disk. Look at the new feature how much memory EQ
actually takes. I will take ALL available memory if it can.
> // Andreas
> ----- Original Message -----
> From: LAINE. Mikael (Nol)
> To: 'EverQuest@yahoogroups.com'
> Sent: Friday, January 10, 2003 12:23 PM
> Subject: RE: [EverQuest] Re: video cards
>
>
> No shit =P Your graphic card beats all released cards from
GeForce =P GeForce FX will be better tho.
> -----Original Message-----
> From: Wulfric Rennison [mailto:wulftech@e...]
> Sent: den 9 januari 2003 21:29
> To: EverQuest@yahoogroups.com
> Subject: Re: [EverQuest] Re: video cards
>
>
> I am running EverQuest on a PIII 800mhz with 1GB of RAM and a
ATI Radeon 128MB 4X AGP video card. I never saw any lag on my
system pre-Luclin. It's only when they souped up the game engine for
better graphics that my system started lagging. Thus the upgrade to
more RAM and a better video card. Now I run on a cable modem.
There's virtually no lag on zones that existed prior to Luclin.
There is still lag on Luclin, but I can turn the clip plane down to
nil and turn off spell effects (which are annoying anyway) and get
almost no lag at all. However, same system specs with a 64MB video
card and was getting major lag in Bazaar. Now it's pretty smoothe.
I plan on upgrading the processor to a 1Ghz or better next month so I
am sure even Bazaar will be fine.
>
> I still contend that a higher end video card can compensate for
a low end processor. But when you've got both together, EQ should be
flawless.
>
> Wulfric/Raido/Celric/Shifu/Sandahl/Savawulf/Ramsen
Cazic Thule Server
> Pseudowulf The Seventh Hammer Server
> Kenjite/Petrus Tunare Server
> Airbourne E'ci Server
>
>
>
>
>
> ----- Original Message -----
> From: Melanie Johnson
> To: EverQuest@yahoogroups.com
> Sent: Wednesday, January 08, 2003 11:34 AM
> Subject: Re: [EverQuest] Re: video cards
>
>
> I'm also running Win ME with 384 megs of ram. It's slowing
down now, due to the fact that my processor is just a Celeron 400 and
is 3 years old (time for an upgrade) but ME has done fine. I can't
remember the last time I got the blue screen of death. I might
eventually upgrade to XP Pro (Home edition doesn't play games very
well), but ME is doing just fine for me now.
>
>
